revision.text:
{{POV|date=May 2011}}'''Downsize DC''' (formerly known as the '''American Liberty Foundation''') is a policy advocacy organization which aims to limit the size of [[government]] in the [[United States]] through awareness and [[petition]]ing. Though it claims to be non-partisan, it does have strong political ties to the libertarian movement.{{cite web|last=Wilson|first=James|title=We're in the top 100|url=http://www.downsizedc.org/blog/in-the-top-100|publisher=DownsizeDC.org}} It was founded by two-time [[United States Libertarian Party|Libertarian]] presidential candidate [[Harry Browne]],[http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2006/mar/02/20060302-112917-9413r//print/ Libertarian leader Browne dies at 72] [[Washington Times]], March 3, 2006. his former campaign staff members [[Perry Willis]] and [[Jim Babka]], and former National Chair of the Libertarian Party [[Steve Dasbach]]. It is split into two organizations, the Downsize DC Foundation and DownsizeDC.org, for tax purposes.{{cite web|url=http://www.downsizedc.org/ |title=About Downsize DC}} The President of Downsize DC is Jim Babka. Harry Browne served for over a year as the Director of [[Public Policy]]. The Chair of DownsizeDC.org is [[Gary Nolan (radio host)|Gary Nolan]]. [[Mark Cenci]] and [[David Page]] both also serve on the [[Board of Directors]]. The chair of the Downsize DC Foundation is [[Jack Mullen]]. Along with Jim Babka, [[Laura Carno]], John McAlister, and [[David Ruprecht]] also serve on the Downsize DC Foundation Board of Directors. DownsizeDC.org focuses both on preventing what it considers "bad" legislation - generally, legislation that grows government - from passing through [[Congress of the United States|Congress]] and on pushing for legislation that would reduce the size of or constrain the growth of government. ==References==
==External links== *[http://www.downsizedc.org/ DownsizeDC.org] [[Category:Libertarian organizations based in the United States]] [[Category:Political advocacy groups in the United States]] [[Category:Year of establishment missing]]
